Bee as a father to the fatherles, and as an husband vnto their Mother, ſo ſhalt thou be as the ſonne of the moſt high; and he ſhall loue thee more then euen thy mother doth. Likewiſe the Prophet Iſay doth paint out charity & the works therof, as a part of righteouſnes: If thou powre out thy ſoule to the hungry, and refreſh the troubled ſoule, then ſhall thy light ſpring out in the darknes, and thy darknes ſhall be as the noone day. And in the ſame place he ſaith, that if a man deale
his bread to the hungry, & bring the poore that wander vnto his houſe, and couer the naked, not hyding himſelfe from his owne fleſh;Iſay 58.7.8.9.10. Then (ſaith he) ſhall thy light breake forth as the morning, and thine health ſhall grow ſpeedily, and thy righteouſnes ſhall goe before thee, and the glory of the Lord ſhall embrace thee. Wherein wee maye learne that as righteouſnes is the life of Chriſtians, acording to Ezekiel, ſo is it the light of Chriſtians according to Iſay. To which purpoſe tendeth likewiſe the exhortation of our Sauiour Chriſt, Let your light ſo ſhine before men, Mat. 5.16. that they may ſee your good workes and glorifie your father which is in heauen. Moreouer that Charity or Loue is the perfection of Chriſtian righteouſnes, it doth appeare abundantly by the teſtimonies
of the holy Apoſtles.Rō. 13.10. Loue doth not euill to his neighbour (ſaith Saint Paul) therefore is loue the fulfilling of the law: and in the ſame chapter he exhorteth thus, Owe nothing to any man, Verſe 8. but to loue one another: for he that loueth another hath fulfilled the law. And writing to the Coloſſians, he calleth Loue the bond of perfectnes, Collo. 3.14 which is as much as the perfection of Chriſtian righteouſnes. And hee that keepeth his word (ſaith Saint Iohn) in him is the loue of God perfite indeede: 1 John 2.5 & 5.3. for this is the loue of God, that we keepe his commaundements, and his commandements are not grieuous. Loue (ſaith the wiſeman) is the keeping of the lawes, & the keeping of the lawes is the aſſurance of immortallity,Wiſd. 6.18 19. and immortallity maketh vs neere vnto God And therefore the Lord maketh
alwaies a coniunct exhortation to loue and obedience:Deut. 30.6 15.16.19.20. behold (ſaith the Lord) I haue ſet before thee this day life and good, death and euill, in that I commaund thee this day to loue the Lord thy God, to walke in his waies, and to keepe his commaundements, and his ordinances, and his lawes, that thou mayeſt liue and be multiplyed, and that the Lord thy God may bleſſe thee: And againe, I call heauen and earth to record this day againſt you, that I haue ſet before you life and death, bleſſing & curſing, therefore chooſe life, that both thou and thy ſeed may liue, by louing the Lord thy God, by obeying his voyce, and by cleauing vnto him, for he is thy life and the length of thy daies. Finally, our Sauiour expreſly affirmeth, that
Loue is both the greateſt commaundement,Mat. 22.36 37.38.39. and the next vnto the greateſt. The firſt, ſtanding & conſiſting in the loue of God, & the ſecond, in the loue of our neighbour.1. Ioh. 2.8. & 3.23. & 2 Ioh. 5 And Saint Iohn teacheth, that loue is both the olde commaundement of the Father, in the old Teſtament, & the new commandement of the Sonne in the new Teſtament: and conſequently loue or charitie, is the conſummation & perfection aſwell of euangelicall as legall righteouſnes.

Thus then wee ſee how that loue or charitie is the chiefe part of the breaſt-plate of righteouſnes, and euen as it were that part of this ſpirituall armour-piece, that couereth and fenceth the heart, which thing the Apoſtle dooth yet more punctually inſinuate,
exhorting the Theſſalonians to the putting on of the Breaſtplate of Faith and Loue. 1. Theſſ. 5.8 And it is of this ſame inherent and actuall righteouſnes, that the ſame Apoſtle ſpeaketh, writing to the Corinthians,2. Cor. 6.7. and calling it by the name of the armour of righteouſnes: Iam. 3.18. & 5.16. and likewiſe Saint Iames when as he ſaith that the fruit of righteouſnes is ſowne in peace of them that make peace, and that the prayer of the righteous man auaileth much.1. Ioh. 2.29 And alſo St. Iohn ſaying he that doth righteouſnes is borne of God:Reu. 22.11 and againe, he that is righteous, let him be righteous ſtill: and Saint Peter, when as he ſaith that wee look for new heauens, and a new earth, according to his promiſe,2 Pet. 3.13 wherein dwelleth righteouſnes; and our Sauiour himſelfe, when
as he telleth vs that he that receiueth a righteus man in the name of a righteous man ſhal receaue a righteus mans reward:Mat. 10.41 as alſo whē as he teacheth vs how that the righteouſnes of Chriſtiās ought to exceed farre the righteouſnes of the Scribes and Phariſes,Mat. 5.20. and withall pronounceth them bleſſed that ſuffer perſecution for righteouſnes ſake:Math. 5.10. and Salomon doth almoſt euery where in his Prouerbs ſpeake of this kinde of righteouſnes, whereby the belieuing ſoule is inherently & actually made righteous, by the working of Gods ſanctifying ſpirit, as may appeare by theſe few teſtimonies, ſelected out of many.

p.hi:
the Lord will not famiſh the ſoule of the righteous, Bleſſings are vpon the head of the righteous, The
memoriall of the iuſt ſhall be bleſſed: he that walketh vprightly walketh boldly, the mouth of a righteous man is a well ſpring of life, the labour of the righteous tendeth to life, the lips of the righteous do feed many, God will grant the deſire of the righteous, the righteous is as an euerlaſting foū dation, the patient abiding of the righteous ſhall be gladnes, the righteous ſhall neuer be remoued.
The righteouſnes of the vpright ſhall direct his way,

the righteouſnes of the iuſt ſhall deliuer them, the righteous eſcapeth out of trouble. In the proſperity of the righteous the Citty reioyceth, by the bleſling of the righteous the Citty is exalted, he that ſoweth righteouſnes ſhall receaue a ſure reward, righteouſnes leadeth to life, the deſire of the righteous is only good, the ſeede of the righteous ſhall eſcape, the righteous ſhall flouriſh as leafe, a
righteous man hateth lying wordes: righteouſnes preſerueth the vpright of life,
the light of the righteous reioyceth, vnto the righteous God will recompence good,
The righteous eateth to the contentation of his minde, hee that walketh in his righteouſnes feareth the Lord, the tabernacle of the righteous ſhall flouriſh, the righteous hath hope in his death, &c.

div.p:
Conſidering then the excellent condition of the righteous man,Prou. 28.1. what meruaile is it though he be bold as a Lyon, to ſpeake with the ſame Salomon? he is bold, and what is it that maketh him thus bold, but this ſelfe ſame inward armour & ſpirituall breaſt-plate which he beareth within his boſome? he is bold, and bold as a Lyon, yea the deuowring Lyon by his boldnes is turned into flight. In one worde, none muſt
dwell in thoſe new heauens and new earth,2. Pet. 3.13 wherein dwelleth righteouſnes (as the great Apoſtle ſpeaketh) but ſuch as in this olde earth haue had new hearts, and Chriſts infuſed righteouſnes dwelling in thoſe new hearts; for onely the righteous ſhall liue for euer:Wiſd. 5.15 16 their reward is alſo with the Lord, and the moſt high hath care of them, therefore ſhal they receaue a glorious kingdome, & a beautifull crowne of the Lords hands.

div.head: CAP. 7. Of the Shoes of peace.
div.p:
THe Chriſtian muſt haue on his feete the ſhooes of peace, that is to ſay, his wayes muſt bee
wayes of peace, and ſuch as are worthy of him that hath bene called vnto the participation of Gods peace: for it becommeth Chriſtians to walke worthy of God,Epheſ 4.1. Philli. 1.2 Coloſ. 1.10 1. Theſſa. 2.12. and of the vocation wherevnto we are called, (ſaith the Apoſtle) and it is fitting that our conuerſation be as it becommeth the Goſpell of Chriſt, which is th Goſpell of peace, and therefore the ſame Apoſtle doth often exhort the faithfull to the ſtudy of peace. Let vs followe then thoſe things, (ſaith he to the Romaines) which concerne peace: Rom. 14.17 19. The kingdome of God (ſaith the ſame Apoſtle) is righteouſnes & peace; and therefore if we deſire to be poſſeſſors of the kingdome of God, we muſt be followers & practiſers of righteouſnes and peace:Eccleſ. 5.10 Rom 12.18 and againe, if it be poſſible
(ſaith he) as much as in you is, haue peace with all men: and writing to the Corinthians, be perfect, 2. Corr. 13 1 • . be of good comfort, be of one minde, liue in peace, and the God of loue and peace ſhall be with you. And writing to the Epheſians he exhorteth all Chriſtians in their perſons, to endeauour to keepe the vnitie of the ſpirit in the bond of peace,Epheſ. 1.1.2 3.4.5.6. as there is one body, one ſpirit, & one hope of our vocation, one Lord, one ſaith, one baptiſme, one God and father of all, which is aboue all, and through all, and in vs all. And to the Philippians,Phill. 1.27 that we continue in one ſpirit, and in one minde, fighting together through the faith of the Goſpell. And to the Hebrewes,Heb. 12.14 follow peace (ſaith he) with all men, and holynes, without the which no man ſhall ſee God. God is the God of
peace, and therefore no man can goe vnto God, except he haue on his feete the ſhoes of peace. Let the peace of God (ſaith the ſame Apoſtle) rule in your hearts, Colloſſ. 3.15 to the which ye are called, in one body, and be ye amiable.

The Chriſtian, as he is at war, yea a continuall warre with the Deuill, the world, and the fleſh, ſo is he at peace with God:Rom. 5.1. For being iuſtified by faith, we haue peace towards God, through our Lord Ieſus Chriſt, ſaith the Apoſtle: and as our God is the God of peace,Rom. 15.33. 2. Cor. 13.11. 1. Theſſ. 5.23 Iſay 9.6. Ephc. 2.14 15.16.17 and Chriſt the Prince of peace, ſo is he both the maker and the preacher of our peace: For he is our peace (ſaith the Apoſtle) which hath made of both one, and hath broken the ſtop of the partition wall, and came and preached peace to you which were a farre off, and to them that
were neere. And this ſame thing the Angells did preſignifie by their ſweet ſong of peace, which they ſung at his birth,Luke 2.14. Glory bee to God in the higheſt heauens, and peace in earth; and towards men goodwill. Giuing vs to vnderſtand, that Chriſt came into the world, to make peace both betweene God and men, and betweene man and man: who as he preached peace vnto men, ſo was it alwaies his cuſtome to wiſh peace vnto men, whenſoeuer hee came amongſt men; ſaying, Peace be vnto you, Luk 24.36 Ioh 20.21. luke 7.50. & 8.48. & 19.42. and diſmiſſing them, to bid them Goe in peace; yea he wept ouer Ieruſalem, becauſe it knew not thoſe thinges that belonged to her peace: And being to leaue the world, he left his peace for a legacy vnto his ſeruants, ſaying, Peace I leaue with you, my peace I giue
vnto you, to the end that in him we might haue peace, and that the peace of God might rule in our hearts,Collo. 3.15 according to the Lords owne ſpeech, and his Apoſtles exhortation.

The whole company and ſociety of Chriſtians make but one army fighting together through the faith of the Goſpell, againſt the enemy thereof Sathan, and all his ſuppoſts. And if we be at peace and concord among our ſelues, we may be ſure to ouercome; but if we be at warre one with another, and if we be deuided one from another, in faith or in affection, we may be no leſſe ſure that Sathan and his army will be able to make among vs a great ſlaughter.Mark 3.24 25 If a kingdome be deuided againſt it ſelfe (ſaith our Sauiour) that kingdome cannot
ſtand; or if a houſe be diuided againſt it ſelfe, that houſe cannot continue; and in like maner if the army of Chriſtians be deuided againſt it ſelfe, it cannot preuaile: and therefore it is that we ſee the ſtudy of vnity, concord, & peace, is ſo dilligently recōmended to vs in holy ſcripture.Rom. 12.16 Be of like affection one towards another, (ſaith S. Paul) and againe, I beſeech you brethren by the name of our Lord Ieſus Chriſt that ye all ſpeake one thing, and that there be no diſſentions among you: but be ye knit together in one minde, 1. Cor. 1.10. 2. Cor. 13.11 and in one iudgement. And yet againe, If there be therefore any conſolation in Chriſt, if any comfort of loue, if any fellowſhip of the ſpirit, if any compaſſion and mercy, fulfill my ioy, that ye be like minded, hauing the ſame loue, being of one accord, and of one iudgement. And as he prayeth and
exhorteth chriſtians to be of one opinion and of one affection, ſo doth he pray vnto God to giue vs that we be like minded one towards a nother, Rom. 15.5 6 according to Chriſt Ieſus, that with one mind & with one mouth we may praiſe God, euen the father of our Lord Ieſus Chriſt. Yea our Sauiour himſelfe in his laſt prayer,Ioh. 17.20 21.22.23. prayed that all beleeuers might be one, and be all made perfite in one. But alas! it is a pittifull thing to conſider how aduerſe the moſt part of men now a daies are, from this ſtudy of chriſtian vnion and peace. The Prophet Iſay of olde complained of the contentions were of his time:Iſay 59.8. That they knew not the way of peace.Pſal. 120.5 6 And King Dauid of the diſſentious men of his age, made the like complaint, I ſeeke peace, and when I ſpeake thereof, they are bent to war,
they make them ready to battell; and the ſame complaint may the peaceable minded men make now adayes with farre greater cauſe, in regard that Chriſtians are on all hands ſo much adicted to diſcord. But the greateſt pitty of all is to conſider how that Chriſtians can be ſo hard-hearted as to behold without pitty or compaſſion the miſticall body of Chriſt, in ſo pittifull a paſſion, as to ſee it ſtretched along vpon the croſſe of the croſſenes of humaine conceites, bored through with the nailes of nicenes, crowned with the pricking thornes of ſubtil Sillogiſmes, & Sophiſmes tranſpearced with the ſpeare of ſpightfull ſeperations, and expoſed vnto the ſcoffage and mockage of both misbelieuing Iewes and vnbelieuing Gentiles. To ſee
I ſay without ſorrow and ſubuention, the Body of the Church of Chriſt lying in the ſight of theſe two ſcoffers of Chriſtianity, like the woūded man left of robbers,Luke 10.30 3 • .32.33.34.35. halfe dead, lying betweene Iericho and Ieruſalem; and to behold both Prieſts and Leuites paſſing by without yeelding any ſuccour or reliefe. So that either ſome Samaritane, ſome Prince, or ſome priuate lay perſon belike muſt put to his hand to powre the oyle of mittigation into the diſſected bodies wounds; & bind them vp, or els the charitable deed is like to lye vndone.

It is the part therefore no doubt of all good Chriſtians, with the kingly Prophet Dauid, to deſire and wiſh peace, to ſeek it,Pſal. 120.6. & • 22 • .7 8.96 to ſpeake of it, and to pray for it. O pray for the peace of Ieruſalem,
they ſhall proſper that loue thee: peace be within thy walles, and plenteouſnes within thy palaces: and not onely this, but euery one ought to ſee ke to doe her good, with the ſame Prophet, and to labour for her peace, by furthering and aduancing the ſame, according to their ſeuerall abilities: yea whoſoeuer deſireth to be bleſſed, or to be accounted & called one of the children of God, ought to endeauoure to be a peace-maker at leaſt in affection, if ſo be that his ability can not reach vnto action and execution.Math. 5.9. Bleſsed are the peace-makers (ſaith the Prince of peace) for they ſhall be called the Sonnes of God. And doubtles a moſt bleſſed and happy thing it were, if once princes and paſtors could be broght to ſacrifice their ſeueral abilities to the procuring
and furthering of this holy peace that the ruines of Sion might be repaired, the breaches and deſolations of Gods houſe redreſſed, and this much deſired concord reſtored at laſt vnto Chriſtendome. That ſuch Iewes & Gentiles as are yet without being no longer ſcandaliſed by our diſſenſions and diſſections; but ſeeing peace and vnity flouriſhing among vs, might be thereby induced to like the better of our religion, and ſo in end might be hailed home vnto the ſociety of the Chriſtian profeſſion, That ſo all the Kings and kingdomes of the earth, may know & acknowledge the Lord Ieſus,Pſal. 2.8.10 11. & 67.7. & 102.15.22 & 86.9. and feare and ſerue him: that his kingdome may encreaſe and flouriſh more and more, being freed from theſe dolefull diuiſions, that do
thus weaken and blacken the ſame, and ſo vnited, may be extended from ſea to ſea, euen from the riuer vnto the ends of the earth,Pſal. 72.8.9.10.11.15.17.19. Iſay 45.22. according to the tenure of the diuine Oracles, touching the plenitude and collection of the Gentiles, the beatitude and conuerſion of the Iewes, and the amplitude and extention of Chriſts kingdome, conſiſting of both Iewes and Gentiles, vnited vnder one ſoueraigne Lord, and ruled by one Chriſtian law.

The which Oracles doe beare, that in the laſt dayes all nations ſhall flowe vnto the Church, ſaying one to another: Come, Iſay 2.2.3. Micah. 1.2. let vs goe vp to the mountaine of the Lord, to the houſe of the God of Iacob, and he will teach vs his waies, and we will walke in his paths: Vp, let vs goe and pray before the Lord, Zach 8.21 and ſeeke the
Lord of hoſtes, we will goe alſo. So that then in this day (ô the thrice happy and deſireable day!) there ſhall be no contrariety or recuſancy amongs Chriſtians: for after long debate and much diſcord, they ſhall breake their ſwords into mattockes,Iſay 2.4. & 11.9. & 63.5. Micah 4.2. and their ſpeares into Sythes; they ſhall not learne to fight any more, neither ſhall they any longer hurt or deſtroy one another in the mountaine of his holyneſſe. As if he ſhould ſay, Chriſtians ſhall burne their bookes of controuerſies, and turne their controuerſie ſhooles into ſchooles of concord, their warring and wrangling ſhal vaniſh, their iarring and iangling ſhall take an end. For the mountaines (that is Chriſtian Princes) ſhall bring peace, Pſal. 72.3. and the hilles (that is heauenly and
humble prieſts) ſhall bring righteouſnes vnto the people. Pſal. 72.7. Iſay 11.9. Haba. 2.24 Iſay 66.12. Then there ſhall be abundance of peace, and the earth ſhall be full of the knowledge of the Lord, as the ſea that ouerfloweth with water; yea he will extend peace ouer his church like a flood, and the glory of the Gentiles like a flowing ſtreame;Zephan 3.9 finally He will turne to the people a pure langage that they may all call vpon the name of the Lord, to ſerue him with one conſent. Euen ſo, come Lord Ieſus, come Prince of peace, & come quickly by thy ſpirit of peace into the heads and hearts of all diuided chriſtians,Ioh. 17.21 22.23. That they may be made perfit in one, as the father & thou art one. Inſpire vs all with the ſpirit of peace, that the common people in their houſes may pray for peace, Schollers in their
ſchooles may write of peace, Preachers in the Church may preach for peace, and Kings and Princes in their kingdomes may worke for peace, and incourage peaceable ſpirits vnto the ſtudy of peace; ſo that at laſt as children of peace; we may ſing vnto the praiſe of the God of peace, that moſt excellent ſong of peace Ecce quam bonum et quam iucundum fratres habitare in vnum. Pſal. 133.1

q.l: O how happy a thing it is,

div.head: CAP. 8. Of the ſhield of faith.
div.p:
BVt aboue all, the Chriſtian muſt take vnto him the Shield
of faith, ſaith the Apoſtle: for it is of ſuch efficacy & force, that it is able to quench all the fiery darts of the deuill, to vanquiſh the world, and to ouercome the wicked one. In the holy Scripture we may read, of the manifold and wonderfull effects of faith: It is of greater force then the moſt ouerflowing floods;Heb. 11.29 30.31.32 33.34.35 for by faith the red ſea was made as dry land for the belieuing Iſraelites to paſſe through into the earthly Canaan. And in like manner all Gods true Iſraelites, according to the promiſe, ſhall paſſe ſafely through the red ſea of this reſtles and ruthles world, into the heauenly Canaan, where there is fulnes of reſt. Faith is ſtronger then the ſtrongeſt towne walles, for by faith the walles of Iericho fell downe after
that they had bene compaſſed about ſeauen dayes. And by the ſame faith, the walles of the ſpirituall Iericho that is, of the citty of ſinne wherein the chriſtian ſoule dwelleth, though not as a Cittizen (for ſo it belongeth vnto the Citty of God, which is the Citty of righteouſnes) but rather as a captiue or priſoner: they ſhal in end fall, after that wee haue compaſſed the ſame by wraſtling and fighting againſt ſinne, ſo many ſeauen dayes or weekes as the world ſhall continue. Faith is ſtronger then kingdomes and kings, for diuers of Gods Champions, as Gedeon, Sampſon, and Dauid, through Faith haue ſubdued kingdomes, and turned to flight the armies of the aliants. And the ſame faith is ſtronger then the kingdome of ſinne and
Sathan, for it ſubdueth the ſame, and ouercommeth both the kingdome and the king thereof. Faith is ſtronger then Lyons,Dan. 3.23.24.25.26.27.28. & 6.16.22 23. 1. King 17.17.18.19.20.21.2 • . 2. King. 4 20.32.33.34.35. for by faith Daniel ſtopped the Lyons iawes; and ſtronger then fire, for the three children through faith quenched the violence of the fiery furnace. Finally, it is ſtronger then death, for through faith, Elias rayſed vp the widdow of Sareptas ſonne, and Eliſha the Shunamites ſonne. And by the ſame faith, the Chriſtian doth ſtop the mouth of the deuouring Lyon, and as it were doth quench the hot fornace of hell-fire: it is ſtronger then death, yea then the author of death, for as it quencheth all the deuills fiery darts, ſo it vanquiſheth the wicked one, it conquereth the ſpirituall death of the ſoule, by aſſurance and
